title: Ketanji Brown Jackson Is Poised To Make History
description:
Tuesday was the second day of Ketanji Brown Jackson's Supreme Court confirmation hearings. She would be the first Black woman to serve as a Supreme Court justice, and the first Democratic nominee to be confirmed since Elena Kagan in 2010. A vote on her nomination could come in weeks, and Democrats have the votes to confirm her without Republican support.

NPR political correspondent Juana Summers spoke to black women working to support Jackson's historic nomination.

In participating regions, you'll also hear a local news segment to help you make sense of what's going on in your community.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

itunes:title: Ketanji Brown Jackson Is Poised To Make History
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Day two of her confirmation hearings proceeded with less acrimony than those of some other nominees in the past. Democrats could vote to confirm her in weeks.
itunes:subtitle: Day two of her confirmation hearings proceeded with less acrimony than those of some other nominees in the past. Democrats could vote to confirm her in weeks.
